text:
A minority cell leader of the BJP has been booked under the stringent National Security Act in view of his “criminal record”, days after he was charged with slaughtering a cow at his house in Dewas district, leading to his expulsion from the party.

“The National Security Act was slapped on Anwar Mev on Thursday in view of his past criminal record,” Dewas District Collector Ashutosh Awasthi said on Sunday night.

BJP’s State unit spokesman Hitesh Bajpai confirmed the development, saying “we have expelled Mev from the party.”

Mr. Mev, former vice president of the BJP’s minority cell in Tonkkhurd Mandal in Dewas district, and nine others are facing a criminal case under the Madhya Pradesh Cow Slaughter Ban Act and the Indian Penal Code, Dewas additional SP Rajesh Raghuvanshi said.

Meanwhile, the Congress has accused the BJP of “dividing” society on communal lines in the name of cow.

“According to reports, the BJP men, some of them Hindus, are involved in slaughter of cows,” said Congress leader Bhupendra Gupta. — PTI
title: BJP leader booked for ‘cow slaughter’
